etymologies: mid 16th century (in an earlier sense). From opinion + -ate

definitions: Holding obstinately to one's own opinion; opinionated.

etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Nashe (d. c1601), writer. From opinion + -ate, perhaps after Middle French opinionner

definitions: To hold as an opinion; = "opine", "opinion"; to believe, suppose, think.
To form, hold, or give an opinion.
(reflexive). To be or become possessed of a (particular) opinion. Now chiefly in past participle.
To state or deliver an opinion formally; = "opine".
